info.title: SMS API Documentation
info.description: Send and receive SMS, business solutions on SMS, Bulk, transactional, promotional SMS in a single solution. Getting started is easy. Even in trial, you can experience SMS communication easily putting yourself in your customers shoe

x-homepage.markdown:
Customer engagement
Complete API solutions that will help you drive better outcomes for your customers and business, throughout the customer journey with rich set of APIs for managing People, Flow, Conversations and more.
### Channels
If you require a straight forward connectivity for your existing solutions this is what you are looking for. Implement one-way or two-way communication over any major mobile messaging channel like SMS, Voice, RCS, WhatsApp, Viber and more.

tags.name: Authentication API
tags.description: All API requests need to be authenticated through the Authorization header. The ACP  API offers the following authentication methods:HTTP Basic authentication,JWT Authentication.Select your preferred method to suit your current tech stack and security requirement level.Many of these methods are vulnerable to man - in -the - middle attacks,so it is recommended to combine them with other security mechanisms such as an encrypted connection or SSL.

tags.name: Authentication for RCS
tags.description: All API requests need to be authenticated through the Authorization header. post.description: Customer will  call this Api service for generating token,which will expire in a limited as of now, it is one day.

Basic authorization type can be used in situations when the API key is not available. For example, API methods for generating API keys should be authenticated with the Basic type.

In this case, the credentials included in the Authorization header should be a Base64 encoded username and password combination. More formally, basic authentication header can be constructed in three steps:

* Username and password are concatenated using the colon `(:)` as a separator `username:password`.
* The resulting string is encoded using the [RFC2045-MIME](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2045.txt) variant of Base64.
* Encoded string is added as credentials after the `"Basic "` type.

Example:

```shell
Username: "Aladdin"
Password: "openSesame"

Concatenated string: "Aladdin:openSesame"

Base64 encoded string: "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuU2VzYW1l"

Authorization header: "Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuU2VzYW1l"
```

> **Implementation detail**: Base64 encoding is a standard and many available programming languages and frameworks provide convenient methods for encoding strings.

Send an audio to a single recipient. Audio messages can only be successfully delivered if the recipient has contacted the business within the last 24 hours, otherwise template message should be used.
The API response will not contain the final delivery status

Token can be Authorization Bearer or Authorization Basic

post.description: Customer will  call this Api service for generating token,which will expire in a limited as of now,it is one day.

Basic authorization type can be used in situations when the API key is not available. For example, API methods for generating API keys should be authenticated with the Basic type.

In this case, the credentials included in the Authorization header should be a Base64 encoded username and password combination. More formally, basic authentication header can be constructed in three steps:

* Username and password are concatenated using the colon `(:)` as a separator `username:password`.
* The resulting string is encoded using the [RFC2045-MIME](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2045.txt) variant of Base64.
* Encoded string is added as credentials after the `"Basic "` type.

Example:

```shell
Username: "Aladdin"
Password: "openSesame"

Concatenated string: "Aladdin:openSesame"

Base64 encoded string: "QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuU2VzYW1l"

Authorization header: "Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuU2VzYW1l"
```

> **Implementation detail**: Base64 encoding is a standard and many available programming languages and frameworks provide convenient methods for encoding strings.

b_call_start_time.description: B party Start Time in the format of `dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi:ss`

b_call_end_time.description: B party End Tim Time in the format of `dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi:ss`

b_duration.description: B party Call duration in seconds

CAMPAIGN_ID.description: Id, which is uniquely identify by each campaig can be numeric values

CALL_START_TIME.description: Scheduled OBD Start Time in the format of `dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi:ss`

CALL_END_TIME.description: Scheduled OBD End Time in the format of `dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi:ss`

type.description: SMS campaign type, 0  Promotional 1  transactional 2 - Service implicit 3 - Service Explicit

senderid.description: Sender ID - Numeric sender ID, which is pre-approved

templateid.description: SMS template ID, Numeric SMS template ID, which is pre-approved

script.description: Alphanumeric SMS content . This parameter will be replaced with SMS template parameters in the same order.

pingbackurl.description: Url to push delivery response provide by customer[details of pingback url described in last section]

msisdn.description: Comma separated mobile numbers with out country code. Allow maximum of 100000 0  number in a single push

name.description: Name of the user to join video room

role.description: Role of the user, joining video room

user_ref.description: Room user ID for reference. Post call, reports include this data for your reference/reporting

description.description: Any description info about your room

duration.description: Total duration of video room. Its required only for Scheduled Room.

moderators.description: Total number of moderator(s) allowed in the Room. 1 moderator is set by default.

participants.description: Total number of participants allowed in the room. This doesnt count the Moderator. 1-50 (For Permanent & Adhoc Room), 1-300 (For Scheduled Rooms). 1-1000 (For Scheduled Rooms in Lecture Mode)

auto_recording.description: If enabled, recordings gets started as soon as any participant publishes into the room. In Auto-Recording enabled sessions, Recording can be stopped and restarted manually using function calls.

quality.description: If your application setting and subscription allows HD streaming, you may opt to use either HD, SD or LD for a room. If not used, EnableX allows subscription based stream quality by default.

name.description: Name of Room or Topic of Meeting
Name of Room or Topic of Meeting

owner_ref.description: Room owner ID for reference. Post call, reports include this data for your reference/reporting

description.description: Any description info about your room

mode.description: Type of Room for video meeting

scheduled.description: Whether the video room is a permanent room or scheduled for a specific duration. Setting it false creates a permanent room.

adhoc.description: Whether the video room is for one time use. To create an adhoc room, you need to set it to true and settings.scheduled as false.

duration.description: Total duration of video room. Its required only for Scheduled Room.

moderators.description: Total number of moderator(s) allowed in the Room. 1 moderator is set by default.

participants.description: Total number of participants allowed in the room. This doesnt count the Moderator. 1-50 (For Permanent & Adhoc Room), 1-300 (For Scheduled Rooms). 1-1000 (For Scheduled Rooms in Lecture Mode)

auto_recording.description: If enabled, recordings gets started as soon as any participant publishes into the room. In Auto-Recording enabled sessions, Recording can be stopped and restarted manually using function calls.

quality.description: If your application setting and subscription allows HD streaming, you may opt to use either HD, SD or LD for a room. If not used, EnableX allows subscription based stream quality by default.

name.description: Name of Room or Topic of Meeting

service_id.description: Room service ID for internal system use

owner_ref.description: Room owner ID for reference. Post call, reports include this data for your reference/reporting

description.description: Any description info about your room

mode.description: Type of Room for video meeting

scheduled.description: Whether the video room is a permanent room or scheduled for a specific duration. Setting it false creates a permanent room.

scheduled_time.description: Format: `YYYY-MM-DD HH:II:SS`. Applicable when scheduled is set to true. This is scheduled start time of the Room. Token will be issues before 15 minutes of start time. Token will not be issued beyond scheduled duration if no participant is available in the room.

adhoc.description: Whether the video room is for one time use. To create an adhoc room, you need to set it to true and settings.scheduled as false.

duration.description: Total duration of video room. Its required only for Scheduled Room.

moderators.description: Total number of moderator(s) allowed in the Room. 1 moderator is set by default.

participants.description: Total number of participants allowed in the room. This doesnt count the Moderator. 1-50 (For Permanent & Adhoc Room), 1-300 (For Scheduled Rooms). 1-1000 (For Scheduled Rooms in Lecture Mode)

auto_recording.description: If enabled, recordings gets started as soon as any participant publishes into the room. In Auto-Recording enabled sessions, Recording can be stopped and restarted manually using function calls.

active_talker.description: If enabled, you can set how many streams you will have in active talkers.

screen_share.description: If you need Screen Share in a room, you may enable it.

canvas.description: If you need canvas streaming (Streaming with contents of HTML5 Canvas Object) in a room, you may enable it.

knock.description: If you need participant to wait before he is allowed by moderator to join a session, then enable knock feature.

quality.description: If your application setting and subscription allows HD streaming, you may opt to use either HD, SD or LD for a room. If not used, EnableX allows subscription based stream quality by default.

billing_code.description: This is for your applications owned reference

abwd.description: If you need disable ABWD (Auto-Bandwidth Detection) in a Room.

facex.description: If you need carry out Face Recognition Analysis in this Room.

max_active_talkers.description: How many maximum streams you need in active talkers. Maximum 9 active talkers can be defined.

custom_key.description: You can define your own keys in this object. None of the keys and their values are validated by EnableX

enabled.description: This is to enable SIP Connection to the Room

flowid.description: Encrypted flowid which will be available in site.

retryintervaltype.description: Retry Interval type, 0 - interval in mins , 1- interval in days

retryintervalvalue.description: Retry interval valueInterval in minutes / Days

Cli.description: Number from which call to be initiated.

seenTime.description: Tells when the message was seen.

sentTime.description: Tells when the message was sent.

messageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the received message

deliveredTime.description: Tells when the message was delivered.

Pull with message id.description: Number of returned messages in this request.

Pull with date.description: Number of returned messages in this request.

MessageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the received message.

results.description: Collection of reports, one per every received message.

To.description: Sender provided during the activation process.

receivedAt.description: Tells when Prudent platform received the message.

MessageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the received message.

infobippushko.openapi.RCS.Type.title: Type
infobippushko.openapi.RCS.Type.description: Type of the message content. Select the type from the dropbox to view their parameters.

Text.description: The text which is sent in an incoming message.

url.description: URL of the file which is sent in an incoming message.

name.description: Name of a file which is sent in an incoming message.

contentType.description: Content type of a file which is sent in an incoming message.

size.description: Size of the file which is sent in an incoming message. Minimum value is 0. Size of file is considered to be expressed in bytes.

results.description: Collection of reports, one per every received message.

messageCount.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the received message.

pendingMessageCount.description: Number of remaining new messages on Prudent servers ready to be returned in the next request.

To.description: Sender provided during the activation process.

MessageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the received message.

ReceivedAt.description: Tells when Prudent platform received the message.

Longitude.description: Longitude. The value must be between -90 and 90.

Latitude.description: Latitude. The value must be between -180 and 180.

Text.description: Content of the end user message.

results.description: Collection of reports, one per every message.

BulkId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the request.

Status.description: Indicates whether the message is successfully sent, not sent, delivered, not delivered, waiting for delivery or any other possible status.

Error.description: Indicates whether the error occurred during the query execution.

MessageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the message sent.

DoneAt.description: Tells when the message was finished processing by Infobip (ie. delivered to destination, delivered to destination network, etc.).

MessageCount.description: The number of sent message segments.

SentAt.description: Tells when the message was sent. Has the following format:

Action.description: Action that should be taken to fix the error.

Permanent.description: Indicates whether the error is permanent.

Currency.description: The currency in which the price is displayed.

messageCount.description: Number of messages required to deliver.

messageId.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the message sent.

action.description: Action that should be taken to eliminate the error.

postbackData.description: Value which is going to be sent as a reply to a suggestion

alignment.description: Alignment type defines alignment in Card message

contents.description: An array of cards contained within the carousel

url.description: URL that will be opened on mobile phone when the suggestion is selected

suggestions.description: List of suggestions that will be sent in card

Status.description: One for success and zero for failure

Buttons.description: Template buttons. Should be defined in correct order, only if `quick reply` or `dynamic URL` buttons have been registered. It can have up to three `quick reply` buttons or only one `dynamic URL` button.

prudentwhatsappstandaloneapiservice.open.description: Template data. Values have to be set as registered in the template.

PlaceHolders.description: Templates parameters values ordered as registered in the template. The value must not be null, but can be an empty array if the template was registered without placeholders. Values within the array must not be null or empty.

prudentwhatsappstandaloneapiservice.open.description: Template body.

Text.description: Value of a placeholder in the text header.

prudentwhatsappstandaloneapiservice.open.description: Template header. Should be defined, only if placeholders or media have been registered in the templates header.

MediaUrl.description: URL of a video sent in the header. It is expected to be a valid URL starting with `https://` or `http://`. Supported video types are `MP4`, `3GPP`. Maximum video size is 16MB.
URL of an image sent in the header. It is expected to be a valid URL starting with `https://` or `http://`. Supported image types are `JPG`, `JPEG`, `PNG`. Maximum image size is 5MB.
URL of a document sent in the header. It is expected to be a valid URL starting with `https://` or `http://`. Supported document type is `PDF`. Maximum document size is 100MB.

PlaceHolder.description: Value of a placeholder in the text header.

text.description: Template header text. Can contain up to 60 characters, with one placeholder {{1}}.

phone_number.description: Phone number to which a phone call would be placed by end-user when hitting the button.

url.description: URL to which the end-user will be directed when hitting the button. URL is expected to start with `https://` or `http://`. Can be static or dynamic. For dynamic URL registration, add a placeholder {{1}} at the end of the link. Example: `https://www.prudent.com/{{1}}`

Parameter.description: URL extension of a `dynamic URL` defined in the registered template.

client_id.description: Your unique username, obtained by signup (user creation) on Infobip portal.

client_secret.description: Your password, obtained by signup (user creation) on Infobip portal.

grant_type.description: Grant type as defined by the OAuth framework.

Messages.description: An array of messages being sent.

language.description: The code of language or locale to use. Must be the same code used when registering the template.

Param.description: The parameter values ordered as registered in the template. The value must not be null or parameter count should be zero if the template was registered without placeholders. The parameter can be upto 20 example param1,param2, param3 etc.

name.description: Template name. Must only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters and underscores.

language.description: The language code or locale to use. Multiple templates with different language codes can be registered under the same template name.

text.description: Template body. Can be registered as plain text or text with placeholders. Placeholders have to be correctly formatted and in the correct order, regardless of other sections. Example: {{1}}, {{2}}, {{3}}...

buttons.description: Template buttons. Can be either up to 3 `quick reply` buttons or up to 2 `call to action(PHONE_NUMBER,URL)` buttons. Call to action buttons must be unique in type.

text.description: Template footer. Plain text, up to 60 characters.

URL of an image sent in the header of a message containing one or more [interactive buttons]. Must be a valid URL starting with `https://` or `http://`. Supported image types are `JPG`, `JPEG`, `PNG`. Maximum image size is 5MB.

URL of a document sent in the header of a message containing one or more interactive buttons. Must be a valid URL starting with `https://` or `http://`. Supported document type is `PDF`. Maximum document size is 100MB.
